page.title: 02The Roman Wreck, Guernsey
page.content: The remains of a twenty metre Gallo-Roman ship were discovered by local diver, Richard Keen, on Christmas Day 1982. Lying in the St.Peter Port harbour entrance in 8 metres of water the site was rapidly being eroded by the propeller wash of cross Channel car ferries. The Guernsey Maritime Trust was formed and an emergency rescue operation mounted under the direction of archaeologist Doctor Margaret Rule, of Mary Rose fame. Coins and other artefacts dated the wreck as 2nd century A.D. The remains of the heavy oak timbers and ship's cargo were recovered in 1984/85.A B.B.C. T.V. film of the excavation was screened in June 1985 entitled Operation Asterix. It is planned to set up a permanent display in Castle Cornet.
